intro: Dischidia merguiensis, commonly known as the Mergui dischidia, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its aerial roots and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Dischidia merguiensis is often found growing on trees in humid, tropical environments.
